description:
'''Dream pop''' (also typeset as '''dreampop''') is a subgenre of [[alternative rock]] and [[neo-psychedelia]] that emphasizes atmosphere and sonic texture as much as [[pop music|pop]] melody. Common characteristics include breathy vocals, dense productions, and effects such as [[reverb]], [[echo]], [[tremolo (electronic effect)|tremolo]], and [[chorus (audio effect)|chorus]].  It often overlaps with the related genre of [[shoegaze]], and the two genre terms have at times been used interchangeably.

The genre came into prominence in the 1980s through groups associated with the UK label [[4AD]], most prominently [[Cocteau Twins]], [[This Mortal Coil]], and [[A.R. Kane]]. Subsequently, UK-based acts such as [[My Bloody Valentine (band)|My Bloody Valentine]], [[Slowdive]], and [[Lush (band)|Lush]] alongside US-based artists [[Galaxie 500]], [[Julee Cruise]], and [[Mazzy Star]] released significant albums in the style. It saw renewed popularity among [[millennial]] listeners following the late-2000s success of indie act [[Beach House (band)|Beach House]].
